audio_caption: The clip begins with soft, melodic instrumental music, creating a pensive mood. A male voice then begins to speak in a thoughtful tone, discussing Facebook becoming a more pervasive part of the "network fabric" of our lives and interacting with government, citizens, and businesses. The music fades into the background as the man continues to speak about the evolving value of "likes." The music fades out entirely as the man concludes his statement.

The audio clip begins with a man speaking in a thoughtful tone, envisioning Facebook as a series of tabs for everything in one's life by 2015, allowing users to "search there," "buy there," and even manage their relationships. He concludes that it will become the "dashboard for life." Another man speaks next, in a similar analytical tone, discussing Facebook's potential role in presenting a "public persona" that is bland and palatable, unlikely to draw ill will. A subtle, melancholic instrumental piece plays in the background, featuring minimalist piano, strings, and percussion, maintaining a somber tone throughout both spoken sections.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker mentioning "a dozen other apps" and young people "defecting" to them, suggesting someone will become an older demographic. The speaker predicts Facebook will wane, expressing it may be exhausting rather than energizing. After a brief moment of quiet, the speaker adds that Facebook may be seen as the establishment, and youth will seek to get "beyond American Idol," indicating an exodus from sales-oriented services. A mellow instrumental piece featuring a keyboard plays, providing a sense of reflection. The track creates an understated backdrop, underscoring the speaker's contemplations on the topic.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating a concept is "just a matter of time, it's just a cycle." A simple, mellow melody is played with string instruments, creating a pensive mood. Another male speaker discusses how something will ultimately "peak" in terms of online capacity and user draw. He continues by describing how complex and contextual the online communication or value will be, suggesting the expansion into the offline world is critical for survival.

The audio begins with a male speaker discussing the possibility of a service "peaking at several hundred million users" and ultimately being "replaced by the next big thing" in a somewhat critical tone. The audio transitions to a female speaker who believes "the future lies in the creation of thriving small businesses," suggesting that "Facebook doesn't really offer a lot of opportunities." The clip concludes with a single word from an unknown speaker.

The clip begins with a female speaker discussing her vision for Facebook, focusing on "entrepreneurialism" and "mixed media, mixed reality events". She suggests integrating the physical world with the platform to generate revenue. Then, the clip transitions to music, with a pulsing electronic beat that creates an atmospheric, somewhat suspenseful, mood.

A male speaker discusses the human ability to join groups and think as groups, suggesting that Facebook could enable this and help people function more collectively, even towards group minds or collective consciousness. The speaker expresses a hopeful and optimistic tone.

The audio begins with someone speaking in an optimistic tone about how connection and understanding can bring people closer and create a smarter human superorganism. There's gentle, atmospheric electronic music playing in the background, contributing to a hopeful mood. The speaker is a man. The clip concludes with the sounds of ambient music.

There are no background sounds or music present.
